title: Variables
summary: Variables store values so you can reuse them later. Think of them as labeled boxes where you can put information and retrieve it whenever needed. For example, you might store a user's name in a variable called 'username' so you can use it throughout your program.
sample_question: What is a variable and why is it useful?

title: Loops
summary: Loops let you repeat an action multiple times without writing the same code over and over. A for loop runs a specific number of times, like counting from 1 to 10. A while loop continues until a condition is met, like repeating until a user types 'quit'.
sample_question: Explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop.

title: Functions
summary: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform a specific task. You define a function once and can call it many times. Functions can take inputs (parameters) and return outputs (return values). They help organize code and avoid repetition.
sample_question: What is a function and what are parameters?

title: Conditionals
summary: Conditionals let your program make decisions based on conditions. The most common is the if statement, which runs code only if a condition is true. You can also use else for alternative actions and elif for multiple conditions.
sample_question: How do if statements help programs make decisions?
